Masayoshi Son.

August 11, 1957 (Age 63) - Tosy, Japan

Founder of SoftBank and Enthruprenour, Investor, and Philanthropist. He is a persuaider who has gained 100 Billion from investor to create a Vision Fund. One of his persuasive meetings that has costed him 45 min had brought $45B. As a result each minute has made him $1 Billion. He is Masayoshi Son and this is his story.

Masayoshi Son page on Wikipedia

About Masayoshi.

Masayoshi Son (August 11, 1957 ) Experienced extreme poverty and discrimination in his early life as a ethnic Korean in Japan. In 1974 leaves his family to study abroad in America, while promising his mother he would return. Graduated high school in 3 weeks by taking the required exams. After spending two years at a local college in 1977, he trasnferred to the University of California, Berkley. It was during this time he realized his passion and belief that microchips would change the world. In 1979 Son invented the electronic translator with the help of some professors. Sold it to Sharp Corporation for $1.7 million dollars. Son graduated from UC Berkeley with a B.A. in Economics in 1980, and started Unison in Oakland, CA, which has since been bought by Kyocera. Son's family had adopted the Japanese surname Yasumoto (安本), and Son had used that surname as a child. He decided to use his Korean surname instead on returning to Japan from the U.S., and became a role model for ethnic Korean children in Japan.

Softbank Corporation was Founded in 1981 it started off as a PC software distribution company back in Fukuoka, Japan. In 1983 Being diagnosed with hepatitis, Son had to leave the CEO position from his growing company to receive treatment. This period had a great impact on his life. Then, In 1986 Miraculously recovering, Son reclaimed his role as head of Softbank. Son was an early investor in internet firms, purchasing a share of Yahoo! In 1995 and investing a $20 million stake into Alibaba in 1999. Son's holding company SoftBank owns 29.5% of Alibaba, which is worth around $108.7 billion as of 23rd October 2018.

The SoftBank Vision Fund.

THE STORY OF $100 BILLION DOLLARS
  • It also runs Vision Fund, the world's largest technology-focused venture capital fund, with over $100 billion in capital.
  • Investor: Brian Knappenberger
  • Supporters: Countires, Companies, Individuals
  • Amount: $100B

“While I was at Berkeley, I had 250 inventions that I wrote down in my “Invention Idea Notes.” Then I picked one to develop a prototype and apply for a patent.”

Masayoshi Son

Think about you dream and have a stronger passion than anybody else. Then you will succeed in any dream that you have

Masayoshi Son

Companies must have much longer life cycles than people. I want to build a company a company that will continue to grow for at least 300 years.

Masayoshi Son
